fields.name: Stan Lee
fields.bio: Lee created comic dynamos like Spider-Man, The Incredible Hulk, Black Panther, and the X-Men.

fields.name: Steve Ditko
fields.bio: Stephen J. Ditko was an American comics artist and writer best known for being co-creator of Marvel superhero Spider-Man and creator of Doctor Strange.

fields.name: Jack Kirby
fields.bio: Jack Kirby was an American comic book artist, writer and editor, widely regarded as one of the medium's major innovators and one of its most prolific and influential creators.

fields.name: Tom King
fields.bio: Tom King is an American author, comic book writer, and ex-CIA officer. He is best known for writing the novel A Once Crowded Sky, The Vision for Marvel Comics, The Sheriff of Babylon for the DC Comics imprint Vertigo, and Batman and Mister Miracle for DC Comics.

fields.name: Gabriel Walta
fields.bio: Artist. Eisner Award winning comic-book artist, painter & illustrator.

fields.name: Mitch Gerads
fields.bio: Eisner Award-winning artist of MISTER MIRACLE, BATMAN, + now STRANGE ADVENTURES from @dccomics! Co-Creator of THE SHERIFF OF BABYLON + THE ACTIVITY.

fields.name: Jeph Loeb
fields.bio: is an American film and television writer, producer and comic book writer. Loeb was a producer/writer on the TV series Smallville and Lost, writer for the films Commando and Teen Wolf, and a writer and co-executive producer on the NBC TV show Heroes from its premiere in 2006 to November 2008.[4] In 2010, Loeb became Executive Vice President of Marvel Television.

fields.name: Tim Sale
fields.bio: Timothy Roger Sale was an American Eisner Award-winning comics artist, best known for his work on the DC Comics characters Batman and Superman and for influencing depictions of the Caped Crusader in numerous films.

fields.name: Kate Leth
fields.bio: Kate Leth is a bestselling cartoonist, writer, designer and illustrator.

fields.name: Matt Fraction
fields.bio: Eisner Award-winning American comic book writer, known for his work as the writer of The Invincible Iron Man, The Immortal Iron Fist, Uncanny X-Men, and Hawkeye for Marvel Comics; Casanova and Sex Criminals for Image Comics; and Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen for DC Comics.

fields.name: David Aja
fields.bio: Spanish comic book artist, best known for his work on The Immortal Iron Fist and Hawkeye.

fields.name: Scott Snyder
fields.bio: American writer. He is known for his 2006 short story collection Voodoo Heart, and his comic book writing, including American Vampire, Detective Comics, Batman, Wytches, Swamp Thing, and Justice League.

fields.name: Greg Capullo
fields.bio: American comic book artist and penciller, best known for his work on Quasar (1991–1992), X-Force (1992–1993), Angela (1994), Spawn (1993–2000, 2003–2004) and Batman (2011–2016).
